InstructionData.Title: 2-axis Solar Tracking with Park
InstructionData.Description:
The STC2A series solar tracking controller accurately calculate the horizontal and vertical position of the sun for 99-100% solar power collection efficiecy. P series tracking systems feature Zero Configuration Night Park® that pre-positions solar panels to face the rising sun for maximum power.
[table] [tr][td]Model[/td][td]STC2A-201-P[/td][/tr] [tr][td]Manufacturer[/td][td]ZeroOne Corporation[/td][/tr] [/table]
[b]Installation[/b]
Requirements: [list] [*] Solar Panels [*] Dalight Sensor (2) [*] Integrated Circuit (2) [*] Batch Writer (2) [*] Memory (2) [/list]
Build solar panels with power port facing east (sunrise).
Mount two daylight sensors face up. The green sensor must face the sun. Point the power port of the horizontal sensor south.
Consult the alignment table if the solar panel power port doesn't face east.
[table] [tr] [td]Panel Power Port[/td] [td]East (sunrise)[/td] [td]South[/td] [td]West (sunset)[/td] [td]North[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Sensor Power Port[/td] [td]South[/td] [td]West[/td] [td]North[/td] [td]East[/td] [/tr] [/table]
Build circuit network and assign IC pins.
[b]Notes[/b]
Solar panels do not park if they are built in the dark. They assume they are recovering from a nighttime power failure and remain in position. The solar panels will park as usual the next evening.
The circuit network doesn't have to be powered at night, since it can turn on at sunrise.
To guarantee morning startup after a daytime power failure, disconnect one solar panel from the data network and align it to sunrise at 0%. The system would still reactivate without this, but possibly not at sunrise.
Night parking occurs when the sun is down and the solar panel reports 0 Charge.
Night parking rotates the solar panel 180 degrees and sleeps until sunrise.
[b]​IC Housing Connections[/b] [list] [*]VDaySensor (D0): Daylight Sensor - Vertical [*]HDaySensor (D1): Daylight Sensor - Horizontal [*]Charge (D2): Any solar panel [*]VSetting (D3): Memory - Vertical [*]HSetting (D4): Memory - Horizontal [/list]
